brief_summary.textblock:
The current protocol desires to implement a large-multicenter observational study of
      hospital acquired infection in ICU in China. The study will generate data on generate data
      about the epidemiology current management of nosocomial infection.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidemiological Investigation of CRBSI, VAP, CAUTI in Chinese ICU

detailed_description.textblock:
The objectives are as followings:

        1. Obtain incidence of three major nosocomial infection in ICU, catheter related blood
           stream infection(CRBSI), catheter related urinary tract infection (CRUTI), and
           ventilator associated pneumonia (VAP).

        2. Determine the epidemic of etiology and condition of management of three major
           nosocomial infection in ICU in China.

criteria.textblock: Inclusion Criteria:all patients admitted into ICU

study_pop.textblock:
All patients admitted into ICU are eligible for this study. All the infected patients were
        treated by the attending physician, and the choice and adjustment of antibiotic were in
        accordance with the recommendations of ATS guidelines.

facility.name: Department of Critical Care , Zhong-da Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Colonization and Infection in Critically Ill Patients: a Multicenter, Prospective, Observational Study in Intensive Care Units (ICUs) in China

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Critical Care Medicine, Zhongda Hospital

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: the incidence rate of VAP, CRBSI,CAUTI of critical ill patients in Chinese ICU

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of critical care medicine, Zhongda Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Prospective
